intro: Calyptranthes densiflora, commonly known as the dense-flowered calyptranthes, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes well-known plants such as eucalyptus and clove. The plant is characterized by its small, white to pale yellow flowers that are densely clustered along the branches. Its leaves are typically narrow and opposite, with a slightly hairy surface. Calyptranthes densiflora is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
